strips.title: Who We Are
strips.text: Navara was founded to bridge the gap between families and the support they actually need. We provide high-quality diagnostic evaluations, evidence-based behavior support, and guided career exploration, all under one streamlined, client focused model.

strips.title: We exist to simplify the process
strips.text: Whether it's understanding a child's development, managing challenging behaviors, or navigating early career decisions, our goal is to give families and young adults the tools, clarity, and confidence they need to move forward.

diagnostics.title: Diagnostic Evaluations
diagnostics.p1: Our comprehensive diagnostic evaluations provide clarity and understanding for families navigating developmental concerns. We combine evidence-based assessment tools with clinical expertise to deliver detailed, actionable insights.
diagnostics.highlight: Understanding is the first step toward meaningful progress.
diagnostics.p2: Our evaluations are thorough, compassionate, and focused on providing families with the information they need to make informed decisions about their child's development and care.

behavioral.title: Behavior Support
behavioral.p1: We provide personalized behavior support services that address the unique needs of each child and family. Our approach combines proven behavioral strategies with practical, family-centered solutions.
behavioral.highlight: Every behavior tells a story. We help you understand and respond effectively.
behavioral.p2: Our behavior support services are designed to help families develop effective strategies for managing challenging behaviors while promoting positive development and family harmony.

pathways.title: Career Pathways
pathways.p1: Our career exploration program helps young adults discover and pursue meaningful career paths. We combine assessment, guidance, and practical experience to support informed career decisions.
pathways.highlight: Your career journey should reflect your unique strengths and aspirations.
pathways.p2: Through personalized guidance and hands-on experience, we help young adults identify career paths that align with their interests, strengths, and long-term goals.

mainContent.p1: Navara was founded to bridge the gap between families and the support they actually need. We provide high-quality diagnostic evaluations, evidence-based behavior support, and guided career exploration—all under one streamlined, client-focused model.
mainContent.p2: We exist to simplify the process of getting help. Whether it's understanding a child's development, managing challenging behaviors, or navigating early career decisions, our goal is to give families and young adults the tools, clarity, and confidence they need to move forward.

differentSection.title: What Makes Us Different?
differentSection.content: We don't believe in long waitlists, cookie-cutter solutions, or overly complicated systems. At Navara, you get direct access to licensed professionals, concise communication, and actionable plans that actually work—because we know your time and trust matter.

team.title: OUR TEAM
team.subtext: Meet the dedicated professionals committed to providing exceptional care and support

members.name: David Nisan Fetman, BCBA
members.introSentence: David Nisan is a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) and doctoral-level psychology trainee
members.fullText: Nisan is a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) and doctoral-level psychology trainee with extensive experience in child development, behavioral assessment, and intervention. In 2025, he founded Navara Behavioral Group with the mission of delivering direct, effective, and family-centered care. Nisan is known for his clear communication style, practical strategies, and deep commitment to helping children and families make meaningful progress.

members.name: Sarah Levine, M.Ed, BCBA
members.introSentence: Sarah Levine is a Senior Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) with expertise in early intervention and educational programming.
members.fullText: Levine has over a decade of experience designing and implementing individualized behavior intervention plans in school and home settings. She earned her Master of Education in Special Education and has trained numerous parents and professionals in positive behavior support techniques. Sarah is passionate about empowering families and educators through data-driven strategies and compassionate guidance.

members.name: Gwen Margaux A. Velarde, CHRA
members.introSentence: Gwen Margaux A. Velarde is a Certified Human Resource Associate (CHRA) with a background in psychology and multidisciplinary support roles.
members.fullText: Gwen holds a Bachelor of Science in Psychology and brings experience across clinical, research, and administrative settings. Since joining Navara Behavioral Group in 2025, she has combined her mental health knowledge with operational expertise to streamline internal systems and enhance team efficiency. Her proactive approach and attention to detail help ensure that every aspect of Navara's day-to-day operations runs smoothly, ultimately supporting the team in delivering consistent, client-centered care.

members.name: Sarah Manela, OTR/L
members.introSentence: Sarah Manela is a pediatric occupational therapist with over a decade of experience helping children build motor, sensory, and daily living skills.
members.fullText: With over a decade of experience in pediatric occupational therapy, Sarah brings deep expertise, warmth, and creativity to her work with children and families. She specializes in helping kids build the motor, sensory, and daily living skills they need to thrive at home, in school, and in the community. As a mom of four herself, Sarah deeply understands the concerns parents face and brings a strong sense of empathy and partnership to her work. Sarah is passionate about creating playful, personalized interventions that empower children and support caregivers every step of the way.

hero.title: DIAGNOSTICS
hero.subtitle: Comprehensive Psychological & Developmental Diagnostics
hero.description: At Navara Behavioral Group, we specialize in high-quality psychological and developmental assessments that empower families, schools, and treatment providers to move forward with confidence.

benefits.title: Fast Turnaround
benefits.description: Get results in days, not months.

benefits.title: Clear, Actionable Reports
benefits.description: No fluff. Every report includes detailed findings and specific recommendations.

benefits.title: Multidisciplinary Expertise
benefits.description: Licensed psychologists, BCBAs, and medical collaboration where needed.

benefits.title: Parent-Friendly Process
benefits.description: We guide you step-by-step, from intake to feedback.

benefits.title: School & Treatment Collaboration
benefits.description: We liaise directly with providers (when authorized) to support services like IEPs, ABA, or therapy.

whoWeServe.title: Who We Serve
audiences: Children, Adolescents and Adults (ages 2 and up)
Schools and ABA agencies in need of diagnostic clarity
Pediatricians and therapists looking for formal evaluation support

steps.title: Free 15-minute phone consult
steps.description: We determine the right assessment package for your needs.

steps.title: Initial intake session
steps.description: We gather history, concerns, and goals.

steps.title: Results meeting
steps.description: We walk you through everything in plain English.

steps.title: Support for next steps
steps.description: We help you share the results with schools or providers and assist with service referrals if needed.

pricing.title: Packages & Pricing
pricing.description: We offer direct-pay diagnostic packages. No waiting lists. No insurance roadblocks.

cta.title: Get Answers. Take Action.
cta.description: Early diagnosis changes outcomes. Let's get started today.
cta.subtitle: Book your free consult
